div1.p: In the United States District Court in and for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the petition of Albert H. Young and Canasaburo Sugiuro, alias, B.K. Sugiuro, for a Writ of Habias Corpus. } No 2504. Defendants' Breif.
Habias Corpus. Proper Proceeding. 15 Cyc.L & P. p.166, Davis V People, 22 Col.1, 43 Fed,122. Ex. D. Nielsen,131 U.S. 176, 33 L.Rd.116 (Utah)
Court will take Judicial Notice of Former Proceedings, and In re.Bennet, 84 Fed. 327, 14 Cen.Dig. #711, p.1310,
Double Punishment, or Jeopardy, Unconstitutional. Art.V of Amendments to U.S. Constituion.

Where offense are identical, as to Time, place, persons, and Motives, of same species, all growing out of same transactions, or where one is an engredient of all, and same character of evidence on one is sufficient on other, then a former acquittal bars second prosecution; It is res adjucicats. 12 Cyc.L.& P. 265, 267, 280, 261, 283 and 285. diss in part is such that the converse of persons mentioned purpose is was amended. U.S. v Bubler, 38 Fed. 498, U.S. v Copper Still, citing same v. Coffey, 47Fed.497. Davis v People 22 Col.1, 43 P.122 In re Bennett, 84 Fed. 324. Ex p.Neilsen,131 US.176, 33 L.Ed. 118 dissents opinion In re Herkowitz 93 Fed. 452. Roland v. People 23 Col. 283, 47 P. 269. Murphy v State, 25 Nebr. 807, 41 N.W. 792.

Had Defendants been Found Guilty it might be different, But having been acquitted, on Same Facts, where they all admitted criminal intent as charged, then this cause and this offence are Not New, They Are A Retrial of the Same. This opinion runs through all the decisions.

An Acquital on a court involving all the transactions, bars prosecution on a part of the same transactions. 12 Cyc.L& P. 283, Ex p. Nielsen, above,122; citing Movey,108 Mass.433, In re Berkowitx " 455. (A Conspiracy case) Wharton's Crim L. 11 Ed.Vol.,pp 517,526,528.
Compelled that no such Corpus Of uu
On plea was L with for argument of case have to set forth -
How about in next Redell 12 cyc 287
United States District Superior Court Western District of State of Washington for Northern Divison. County
In the Matter of Petition of Albert H. Young, et. al. for Plaintiff vs. Writ of Habias Corpus. Defendant
Filed in the U.S. District Court Western Dist. of Washington. Jun 7 1913 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk. By EML Deputy
R.W. McClelland and W.S. Martin Phone Main 120. 805 Leary BLDG., Seattle, Wash. Attorneys for Petitioners.
Reciept copy of the within Brief and due service of the same admitted this 2nd day of July 1913. M. Crodell Attorney for U.S.
